title: 7 Tips for Getting Motivated to Exercise
summary: Keeping a journal of your workouts is a great way to figure out what exercises work for you. Find your exercise “drug” and use it to motivate yourself to exercise. Don’t forget why you’re exercising in the first place. Find a running buddy or partner who shares your interests and motivations. Set concrete goals to improve your health and fitness levels, but it’s also a goal in and of itself. Start small, work up a routine, and go from there.

What are your strengths? What are your weaknesses? Which activities leave you feeling invigorated? Which ones leave you feeling exhausted? Keeping a journal of your workouts is a great way to figure out what exercises work for you. It also gives you a place to reflect on your progress and keep track of how you\u2019re improving over time. If you don\u2019t know where to start, you can refer to this article that breaks down the best exercises for every part of your body."),mdx("h2",null,"Start small"),mdx("p",null,"Exercising is not something that happens over night. It\u2019s something that you develop a habit of over time as you gradually build up your strength, endurance, and willpower. It\u2019s important that you don\u2019t try to do too much too soon. If you try to push yourself too hard too quickly, you\u2019ll end up burning out and giving up. You\u2019ll also risk injury and that\u2019s the last thing we want. Start small, work up a routine, and go from there."),mdx("h2",null,"Find your exercise \u201Cdrug\u201D"),mdx("p",null,"We all have our vices \u2014 things that we habitually do that aren\u2019t exactly good for us \u2014 but we don\u2019t have the willpower or drive to stop. You may have a similar thing going on with exercise. Maybe you\u2019re addicted to the way it makes you feel, perhaps you live for the rush you get from a challenging workout, or maybe you feel like it\u2019s incredibly important for your mental health. Whatever it is, find your exercise \u201Cdrug\u201D and use it to motivate yourself to exercise."),mdx("h2",null,"Set concrete goals"),mdx("p",null,"Exercising is something you do to improve your health and fitness levels, but it\u2019s also a goal in and of itself. What are your fitness goals? Do you want to lose weight? Do you want to build muscle? Do you want to run a marathon? Whatever your goal is, don\u2019t let it go. Stay focused on it and use it as a motivating factor to help you get through the hard times. What can you do today to move one step closer to your fitness goal?"),mdx("h2",null,"Make it a ritual"),mdx("p",null,"Some people meditate. Others read a book. There are tons of different ways to unwind, relax, and de-stress. You may have a ritual that you perform every day \u2014 but what about an exercise ritual? What do you do every day (or at least multiple times per week) to get yourself fit? Exercise should always be a part of your routine. "),mdx("h2",null,"Find a running buddy or partner"),mdx("p",null,"Exercising with a friend or partner can be a great motivator. If you have a friend or family member who likes to work out, invite them to go with you. Alternatively, you can look online and find a running buddy or partner who shares your interests and motivations. Having someone you can go out and exercise with can make a huge difference when you\u2019re struggling to motivate yourself to work out. It can be incredibly helpful to have someone to talk to and share your experience with."),mdx("h2",null,"Don\u2019t forget why you\u2019re exercising"),mdx("p",null,"Finally, don\u2019t forget why you\u2019re exercising in the first place. Why are you working so hard to improve your health? What benefits does it have? Why does it matter if you don\u2019t like exercising? If you can figure out why you\u2019re exercising in the first place, you\u2019ll find it much easier to stay motivated throughout the whole process."),mdx("p",null,"Exercising is a necessary part of any healthy lifestyle. It\u2019s one of the best ways to stay active, improve your mental health, and stay fit as you get older. If you want to lead a healthy life, you have to get up off the couch and start moving. However, getting motivated to exercise can be a tricky thing \u2014 but it can be done. Follow these tips, use the advice listed above, and you\u2019ll be fit in no time."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Healthy Snacks to Keep You Going

You probably spend the first few hours of it at your desk, sipping on a cup of coffee, reading emails, and maybe even taking a brief walk around the office to stretch your legs. Then you head back to your desk, only to dive into an afternoon filled with more reading and typing\u2014no time for walking again. And by 5pm you\u2019re ready to call it a day and head home. However, in that short span of time, you need to find some way to keep going through all those tasks. What do you do?
The answer is simple: Healthy snacks! Think about how much time you spend away from home throughout the day \u2013 whether it\u2019s at work or school, there are plenty of opportunities for snacking. In fact, keeping healthy snacks around can help boost your energy when you need it most. Check out these top-rated healthy snacks that will keep you going all day long\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

10 Easy Ways to Cut Sugar from Your Diet

From the link between sugar and obesity to the prevalence of diabetes, research on sugar and its potential health effects continues to grow.
There are many different types of sugars out there, but common table sugar or sucrose is the one you need to cut back on. Eating too much sugar can lead to weight gain, high blood pressure and other health problems. If you\u2019ve read any articles about how bad sugar is for you, then you probably already know this. However, cutting back on sugar isn\u2019t always easy. Sugar is in almost everything! Luckily, we\u2019ve compiled a list of 10 super helpful tips that will teach you how to cut back on your intake of this not-so-nice white substance\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

But you don\u2019t have to sacrifice your health to save money or reduce time spent in the kitchen.
A nutritious diet doesn\u2019t have to be expensive or time-consuming. With some planning and preparation, you can make home-cooked meals that are both cheap and healthy. Healthy eating is more than just counting calories; it\u2019s about focusing on foods that are unprocessed and rich in vitamins, minerals, and other nutrients. Eating well helps keep you lean, boost your immune system, manage your weight, and prevent chronic diseases like heart disease and type 2 diabetes. Focusing on the right foods will help get you there. Let\u2019s take a look at some tips on how to cook healthier meals at home!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

With a strict diet, you will be able to burn fat effectively and efficiently, leading to weight loss in just a week. Reducing fat from the body requires breaking down of fats in the body through physical activities. Do you load up on fruits and vegetables every day? Do you take vitamins as part of your daily routine? Do you check nutrition labels to make sure your food is healthy? If you answered yes to all these questions, then why do you feel like you\u2019re not getting enough vitamins and minerals in your diet? There\u2019s nothing more frustrating than feeling like our eating habits aren\u2019t doing us any good. And unless you\u2019re eating an extremely restrictive diet, it can be disheartening to know that most of us don\u2019t get the recommended amount of vitamins and minerals from our diets.
What are vitamins and minerals? They are nutrients that our bodies need in small amounts for everyday processes. While deficiency can lead to some serious problems, getting too much of certain nutrients is also unhealthy. Here is everything you need to know about vitamins and minerals:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

Break-ups are never easy, and they can be even more difficult and hurtful if it\u2019s with your first love or someone you really cared about. These tips will help get you through any heartbreak and back into a place of peace.
When you experience a break-up, whether it\u2019s from a partner, friend or family member, it leaves you with an empty feeling. It hurts so much because you placed so many emotions into the relationship that it now feels like a part of who you are has been taken from you. Even though the person who broke up with you may have been oblivious to the pain they were causing by ending things, that doesn\u2019t make breaking up any easier for anyone involved.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
